page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: In Creswell, the Model Village was built by the Bolsover Colliery Company in 1897 to provide accommodation for its employees. The houses were built in an octagon around a large central green which provides a pleasant area for recreation. All of the houses are within a few hundred metres of the colliery itself. Welbeck Street and Duke Street consist mainly of terraced houses built after the turn of the century. More recently still an area of semi-detached Council housing was built, with some bungalows especially for old age pensioners. There are also smaller areas of detached and semi-detached private houses.
